tables.title: Makeshift Market Vendors
tables.description: Who is trading at a ramshackle market built from welded street signs?

entries.result: Mutated farmer selling drought-proof tubers wrapped in foil.
Scrapper pair trading copper wiring and rare earth dust by the gram.
Charismatic raider offloading confiscated ammo belts at a markup.
Nomad caravan elder swapping handmade filter masks for stories.
Children with a pet rad-ferret trading rumors for sweetened tea.
Traveling medic bartering antibiotics for pre-war magazines.
Tinkerer displaying drone parts and offering quick repairs.
Cult emissary distributing glowsticks blessed by their reactor idol.
Deserter guard exchanging access codes for an escort out of town.
Archivist selling data chips that might still hold music playlists.

tables.title: Bunker Services
tables.description: What services does an underground bunker outpost offer today?

entries.result: Radiation cleansing shower that strips grime and germs alike.
Bullet casting station run by a gruff machinist.
Decontamination vault to store volatile salvage overnight.
Communications hub patching into aging satellite nets.
Hydroponic garden with crisp greens and ration-friendly recipes.
Training room with padded walls and makeshift sparring gear.
Gene-screening clinic identifying plague carriers at the gate.
Safe bunk rentals guarded by recycled security drones.
Jury-rigged vehicle elevator for quick repairs under fire.
Quiet archive full of salvaged maps and rationed power for copies.

tables.title: Faction Attention
tables.description: Which power bloc notices the party's movements?

entries.result: Relic hunters request a cut of any tech lifted from nearby ruins.
Water barons send a measured envoy with strict trade rules.
Mutant conclave quietly tails the crew to gauge intentions.
Radio-free collective invites cooperation against raiders.
Sky-scavenger kite gang circles above, marking targets with paint.
Corporate remnant agent offers obsolete but sturdy credentials.
Road reavers block an overpass, demanding tolls in fuel.
Warden drones broadcast a curfew and scan everyone twice.
Traveling preachers denounce hoarding and seek donations.
Antenna array reactivates, drawing every scav crew in range.

tables.title: Wasteland Weather Surprises
tables.description: Sudden atmospheric twists that complicate travel.

entries.result: Superheated gusts warp metal tools and blister exposed skin.
Electrostatic fog makes hair stand and radios crackle nonstop.
Ashfall reduces visibility to arm's length and clogs filters.
Icy needle rain that preserves corpses and batteries alike.
Glowing auroras trigger faulty electronics to boot in loops.
Sudden stillness before a microburst tosses light gear skyward.
Dust devils full of bone shards chase anything that moves.
Pressure dip whistles through cracked towers, masking footsteps.
Brief clean air pocket allows an hour without masks.
Phosphor rain paints trails visible to anyone with optics.

tables.title: Ruined Transit Snags
tables.description: Delays and dangers along shattered highways and rails.

entries.result: Collapsed overpass funnels vehicles into a narrow killbox.
Mag-rail cars fused together block the path, humming softly.
Sinkhole reveals a half-buried commuter shuttle with supplies.
Automated toll booth still fires stun rounds at unpaid drivers.
Charred convoy wreckage attracts hungry carrion birds.
Signal jammers blanket the area, breaking maps and comms.
Detour leads through a maze of shipping containers stacked high.
Flooded underpass hides razor wire submerged in oily water.
Rail-mounted scavenger gang speeds past, tossing caltrops.
An intact charging station promises power but draws lightning.

tables.title: Radiation Warning Signs
tables.description: Subtle or blatant clues that an area is hot.

entries.result: Melted glass puddles glitter beside warped streetlights.
Geiger counter ticks even when switched off and packed away.
Two-headed crows perch silently, watching travelers.
Road paint glows faintly at night like a toxic runway.
Rust-free tools lie abandoned, as if freshly placed.
Wind carries metallic taste that sticks to teeth.
Ivy grows in perfect spirals up concrete supports.
Warning signs in multiple languages have been recently replaced.
A feral dog glows under UV light before vanishing into reeds.
Concrete barriers painted with fresh lead-based sealant.

tables.title: Hidden Salvage Caches
tables.description: What stash do the survivors unearth under debris?

entries.result: Ammo tins sealed with wax and labeled in faded marker.
Water purifier tablets packed alongside brittle notebooks.
Hand-crank generator wrapped in tarp and copper mesh.
Old-world spices vacuum-sealed and still pungent.
Stacked plastic bins of medical gauze and bone saws.
Ancient hard drives with partial maps of underground lines.
Sealed crate of glowflares stamped with military warnings.
Cracked but functional solar lanterns with extra cells.
Case of vintage comics worth favors to collectors.
Prototype rebreather mask that hums when exposed to dust.

tables.title: Ancient Tech Oddities
tables.description: What pre-fall device or fragment surfaces?

entries.result: Personal AI core begging for a firmware patch.
Collapsible solar sail wrapped in heat-resistant cloth.
Hologram projector stuck on a looping family message.
Self-sealing medical foam canister with a half charge.
Smart-lens glasses that overlay outdated city data.
Portable desalination straw with a cracked display.
Wristband that records vitals and loudly broadcasts them.
Cube battery that trickle-charges when spun.
Prototype shotgun that magnetizes scrap into slugs.
Encrypted drive labeled simply: 'Restart'.

tables.title: Weird Cult Signs
tables.description: Symbols and omens left by wasteland cults.

entries.result: Pyramid of car batteries wired to a singing speaker.
Bone windchimes tuned to a single unsettling note.
Tar-coated graffiti of an eye over a burning city.
Spiral of ration tins leading to a buried reliquary.
Melted polymer idols fused with glass beads.
Stacked televisions showing static except at midnight.
Chalk line encircling a safe zone no cultist crosses.
Perfume-scented incense that masks radiation smell.
Scattered teeth arranged like coordinates on a map.
An abandoned sermon printed on flexible solar film.

tables.title: Roadside Messages
tables.description: Handmade signs and broadcasts left for travelers.

entries.result: Painted arrow promising clean water two miles east.
Looping radio broadcast warning of spores ahead.
Flapping banner that reads 'DON'T STOP. THEY LISTEN.'
Charcoal map scratched into asphalt showing a safe route.
Spray-painted plea: 'Trade doctor for transport'.
Triangulation marks showing sniper nests already cleared.
Stack of rocks with a coded message in bottle caps.
Drone-recorded hologram offering salvage bounties.
Fresh tire ruts and chalk indicating a hidden garage.
A melody whistled through pipes signaling a safehouse nearby.
